citation.article-title: Dokdonella koreensis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Dokdonella (Dok.do.nel′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Dokdonella of Dokdo, an island located on the East Sea in Korea, from where the organisms were isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming and rod-shaped.
Motile by means of polar peritrichous flagella.
The major fatty acids are iso-C17 : 1ω9c, iso-C17 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0.
Major polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and an amino-group-containing lipid that is ninhydrin-positive.
The DNA G+C content is 71·0 mol%.
The type species is Dokdonella koreensis.
